EsTiIMATED CoOST OF BRIDGE AND APPROACHES 121

Superstructure.—The superstructure is divided into structural steel and
flooring, the weight and area of which have been estimated, and the total cost
determined on the basis of the unit prices listed in Table 50.

TABLE 50
Superstructure—Estimate of Cost

ITEM





No. DESCRIPTION ESTIMATED QUANTITIES UNIT PRICE AMOUNT
1 Structural Steel 24,848,400 1bs. $0.075 $1,863,630
2 Flooring 243,000 sq. ft. | 1.00 243,000
Total-Superstructure ................. . $2,106,630



Approach Roadway (Maryland).—The cost of the approach roadway has
been divided into the classifications of work including clearing and grubbing,
grading, paving and guard fence, with quantities and unit prices estimated,
as listed below in Table 51.









TABLE 51
Approach Roadway (Maryland)—Estimate of Cost
I;Eo:?d DESCRIPTION ESTIMATED QUANTITIES UNIT PRICE AMOUNT
1 Clearing and Grubbing 7 acres $110.00 $770
2 Grading 77,000 cu. yds. 0.45 34,650
3 Paving 5,000 sq. yds. 2.10 10,500
4 Guard Fence 3,100 lin. ft. .55 1,705
Total-Approach ROSAWAY :: oo vmms ot ses s o508 masss s aiss 5866508 55 mms i o o $47,625



Toll Booths and Admanistration Building.—The cost of toll booths and ad-
ministration building, as stated below, includes the cost of furnishings and
toll taking equipment to be installed ready for operation.

Total Toll Booths and Administration Building. . ... ... $40,000

Contingencies.—Contingencies have been added to cover unforeseen exi-
gencies of construction, and amounts to approximately 59, of the value of
the substructure.

Contingencies. . . ...t $100,625
Total Construction Cost............... ... ........ $4 ,301 ,800

D. Engineering, Architectural, and other Technical Service Fees

Engineering and architectural fees have been estimated on the basis of
69, of the total construction cost, to which has been added an estimated
